meanings.definition: To speak again or repeat something that has already been said.
meanings.sent1: She decided to respeak her answer to make sure everyone understood.
meanings.sent2: I will respeak the instructions for clarity.
meanings.sent3: He had to respeak his apology after accidentally mumbling the first time.
meanings.sent4: The echo in the canyon respeaks every word you say, creating a magical effect.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the student to respeak the poem with more emotion.

meanings.definition: To express verbally or communicate through speech.
meanings.sent1: The spokesperson will respeak the company's official statement to the press.
meanings.sent2: It is important to respeak your feelings to avoid misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The parrot loves to respeak phrases it hears around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes respeak the sadness she tries to hide with a smile.
meanings.sent5: The song lyrics respeak the emotions of heartbreak and longing.

meanings.definition: To convey a message or idea through spoken words.
meanings.sent1: The storyteller will respeak the moral of the fable at the end.
meanings.sent2: It is challenging to respeak complex concepts in a simple way.
meanings.sent3: The comedian likes to respeak jokes in a silly voice for added humor.
meanings.sent4: His silence respeaks louder than any words he could say.
meanings.sent5: The painting respeaks the artist's passion for nature and beauty.
